post_text: There will be no school in Melrose on Friday, February 8th due to weather. Additionally, all Melrose Public School buildings are closed; therefore all extra-curricular activities for the entire weekend are cancelled. Please check our website for updates. Thank you.

post_text:
The Melrose High School Drama Club will be performing The Complete History of America (abridged) by Adam Long, Reed Martin, and Austin Tichenor this weekend, November 30th and December 1st in the Melrose Performing Arts Center. The directors are seniors Emily Heath, Sarah Ried, Caroline Butts, Raquel Doucette, and Allie Grady along with the Drama Club advisor Mr. Timothy J. Daly, a 2002 MHS graduate.

This fun for all ages comedy is a ninety minute adventure through the major events of American History. Performances will be 7:30pm on Friday, November 30th, and 2:00pm and 7:30pm on Saturday, December 1st. Tickets can be purchased the day of the show at the box office outside the auditorium. Tickets for students and seniors are $7 and adult tickets $10. Refreshments will be sold during intermission. Thanks for supporting Melrose Drama.

post_text:
Due to reports of a gas odor at the high school building today students were relocated to the middle school for precautionary reasons. After a thorough investigation National Grid and the Melrose Fire Department have determined that it was safe for all students and staff to return to the building.

There is however, some repair work that needs to be done which will require the HVAC system to be shut down. School administrators have decided to dismiss students at 10:00AM on Monday, November 5th since the building will be without heat, air intake and gas. There will be no school for students on Tuesday, November 6, which is Election Day and a scheduled Professional Development Day for all staff in Melrose. High School students are expected to return on Wednesday, November 7.
text:

There is however, some repair work that needs to be done which will require the HVAC system to be shut down. School administrators have decided to dismiss students at 10:00AM on Monday, November 5th since the building will be without heat, air intake and gas. There will be no school for students on Tuesday, November 6, which is Election Day and a scheduled Professional Development Day for all staff in Melrose. High School students are expected to return on Wednesday, November 7.

post_text: Hoover 3rd, 4th, and 5th grade students had an opportunity to help National Geographic Kids magazine set a Guinness World Record title for having more than 5,000 people worldwide run 100 meters in 24 hours. The intiative, "Run for the Planet", inspires kids and families to do something good for their health and the environment. Many thanks to the Knight-Heath Family and Health Teacher Gene Metteo for helping to organize the event, School Committee Member Margaret Driscoll and Bridge Volunteer Susan Federico for being our "official" witnesses, and our parent volunteers.

post_text:
Melrose Education Forum: October 4, 2012, 7:00 pm

WHAT: The Melrose Public Schools are implementing the Common Core Standards this year. Want to learn more?

Please attend this free event for parents and community members on how the new Common Core Standards in English Language Arts (ELA) and Math will affect teaching, learning, and testing throughout Melrose. The forum will feature presentations and a panel discussion with Superintendent Cyndy Taymore, Curriculum Director Margaret Adams, and Melrose school principals.

Co-sponsored by Mayor Rob Dolan, Superintendent Cyndy Taymore, and the Melrose Education Coalition, this forum is the first in a series focused on current issues in education.

Reception to follow: meet the Melrose Public Schools leadership team!

WHEN: Thursday, October 4, 2012, 7:00-9:00 pm

WHERE: Melrose High School: Resource Room

MORE INFO: https://sites.google.com/site/melrosemec/
